alert.note: Alert for Garfield; San Juan; Wayne (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 6:47PM MDT until August 20 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central San Juan County in southeastern Utah... Northeastern Garfield County in southern Utah... Eastern Wayne County in southern Utah... * Until 1000 PM MDT. * At 647 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of North Central San Juan, Northeastern Garfield and Eastern Wayne Counties, including the Maze District of Canyonlands National Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
